author: timbeiko
content:
While I'm pretty reluctant to silence criticism, <@155753175494688768> this is your second time in a few weeks using this channel to vent about your frustrations with the Ethereum roadmap without engaging with the actual specifics of proposed (or potential) protocol changes. 

Again, if you want to contribute to improving UX, I invite you to participate in the discussions in <#718596092828057631>. But please stop using <#745077610685661265> as an outlet for your rants, as there are many other places on the internet for that and few others for the people actually working on Ethereum to coordinate.

author: timbeiko
content:
And, on that note, for everyone else: **ACDE tomorrow at 14 UTC**

Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1142
Stream: https://youtube.com/live/HJ9WxAOwTTA
Zoom will be shared here prior to the call

author: draganrakita
content: Made PR for EIP-7702 that requires authorization chain_id check in same time as `y_parity` and `s` check. This would make tx invalid if chain_id is something different from 0 or 1. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8833/files

author: parithosh
content: am i misunderstanding the change? wouldn't this mean that the tx on devnets/testnets is considered invalid?

author: marioevz
content: FYI all there is a hotfix release for the tests here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/pectra-devnet-3%40v1.3.0

author: 0x1984
content: can we open a roadmap channel under general to share the rants if this is only for ACDE, proposals and bugs?

author: draganrakita
content: Revm is passing all EIP-7702 tests, should have a release tomorrow and integration with Reth shortly after
